frame.name: Color
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Color</fen> serves as a landmark in color-space, either a point-like landmark (e.g. <ment>burnt sienna</ment>) or a broader region (e.g. <ment>blue</ment>). Especially when the <fen>Color</fen> designates a broad region in color-space, it may be defined with a specific <fen>Type</fen>, further specified by comparison to the color of a <fen>Comparand</fen>, modified by a <fen>Color_qualifier</fen>, or evaluated with a <fen>Descriptor</fen>. All color words are generally used to specify the color of some (physical) <fen>Entity</fen>. <ex>I really like that shade of <fex name="Color"><t>blue</t></fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">The welts on his side</fex> had already <m>turned</m> an <fex name="Descriptor">angry</fex> <fex name="Color"><t>red</t></fex>.</ex> <ex>The room was bathed in a soft <fex name="Color"><t>pink</t></fex> <fex name="Entity">light</fex>.</ex> <ex>They promptly set up a zillion <fex name="Color_qualifier">bright</fex> <fex name="Color"><t>vermilion</t></fex> <fex name="Entity">pavilions</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">His face and hands</fex> <m>were</m> <fex name="Color"><t>brown</t></fex> <fex name="Cause">from a life spent in the bright sun of the fields</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Entity</fen> described by the <fen>Color</fen>. <ex><fex name="Entity">His jacket</fex> was absolutely <t>green</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Color
FE.definition: <def-root>A position in color-space, generally used to describe the quality of some <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category of a <fen>Color</fen> is indicated. <ex>It is said that the eyes of the prophet will be of the deepest <fex name="Type">azure</fex> <t>blue</t>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Comparand
FE.definition: <def-root>A physical entity (or type of physical entity) whose color is similar to the designated color. When this FE occurs with adjective targets, (a relatively rare circumstance) the <fen>Comparand</fen> also serves to specify a <fen>Type</fen>, which should be labeled on the second FE layer. <ex>Her lips looked <fex name="Comp">sunset</fex> <t>red</t> in the light of the single lamp.</ex> <ex>The ents stared out at us with eyes the deep <t>green</t> <fex name="Comp">of the forest</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Color_qualifier
FE.definition: <def-root>A phrase that indicates the direction in color-space from the center of the region designated by the Color. <ex>Its gill-flaps turn a sort of <fex name="Qual">reddish</fex> <t>orange</t> when it has the disease.</ex> <ex>I told him not to use the <fex name="Qual">dark</fex> <t>brown</t>, but he didn't listen.</ex> <ex>For a moment the whole sky turned <fex name="Qual">bright</fex> <t>pink</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Some characteristic or judgment of a <fen>Color</fen> implicitly imposed by a speaker. <ex>Her feathers were dyed a <fex name="Desc">lovely</fex> <t>purple</t> for the occasion.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Color</fen> is dependent on. <ex>His face was <t>red</t> <fex name="Cause">with anger</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The closeness of the <fen>Entity</fen> 's color to the center of a <fen>Color</fen> prototype.
<ex>The plums are <fex name="Degr">very</fex> <t>red</t>, and very ripe.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Entity</fen> that has the indicated <fen>Color</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition:
<def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion, namely color.
<ex> The wine is bright <t>red</t> <fex name="att">in color</fex> with aromas of red fruits, toasted almond, clove and orange peel. </ex></def-root>
